body_html:
The only guaranteed way to get a LocalMaster is to pass server.target as the session target. Perhaps we could document this better, but I'd prefer to keep the rule for dispatching to the local master as simple as possible.

Is there any reason why you prefer to construct the session target manually?
body_text:
The only guaranteed way to get a LocalMaster is to pass server.target as the session target. Perhaps we could document this better, but I'd prefer to keep the rule for dispatching to the local master as simple as possible.
Is there any reason why you prefer to construct the session target manually?
body:
The only guaranteed way to get a `LocalMaster` is to pass `server.target` as the session target. Perhaps we could document this better, but I'd prefer to keep the rule for dispatching to the local master as simple as possible.

Is there any reason why you prefer to construct the session target manually?
